title: Ditch Proprietary JSON: Build AI Workflows You Can Actually Own with Bubble Lab
article: Have you ever felt trapped by proprietary workflow builders? You spend hours crafting complex automation logic, only to realize the output is a messy, opaque JSON file that you can't properly debug, integrate, or deploy outside of that specific platform. That feeling of vendor lock-in is exactly the problem Bubble Lab solves. This open-source project is an AI-native workflow automation platform built from the ground up for developers who prioritize control, transparency, and, most importantly, type safety.Bubble Lab provides a powerful visual studio where you can design agentic flows using a composable system of "bubbles"â€”nodes representing integrations, tools, and logic. But the real magic starts before you even drag a node. Thanks to Pearl, the built-in AI assistant, you can simply describe the workflow you need in plain English, and Pearl instantly generates a working flow structure for you. This 'Prompt to Workflow' feature radically accelerates development, allowing you to focus on refinement rather than setup.The true game-changer is how Bubble Lab handles deployment. Unlike traditional tools that force you to execute proprietary JSON, Bubble Lab compiles your entire visual flow into clean, production-ready TypeScript code. You literally export your workflow as code that you can own, read, debug, and integrate directly into your existing codebase and CI/CD pipelines. This completely removes the fear of vendor lock-in and gives you the full flexibility of standard software development practices.When dealing with complex, multi-step AI agents, debugging is paramount. Bubble Lab addresses this with full observability built right in. Every flow execution is traced meticulously, providing detailed logs, performance metrics, and token usage tracking. If a step fails or an agent misunderstands a prompt, you have complete visibility into the execution path, allowing you to pinpoint issues instantly rather than relying on vague error messages.For those looking to migrate, Bubble Lab even offers seamless import functionality for existing workflows from platforms like n8n, translating their proprietary JSON structure into the Bubble Lab architecture. This project represents a shift in how we approach automation: moving from locked-down black boxes to fully transparent, exportable, and type-safe code that truly belongs to the developer.
key_takeaways: Workflows compile directly into clean, production-ready TypeScript code, eliminating vendor lock-in.
The AI Assistant, Pearl, uses natural language 'Prompt to Workflow' generation to speed up development dramatically.
Provides full observability, including detailed execution tracing, logs, and token usage tracking for easy debugging of complex AI agents.
Bubble Lab is open-source and built for type safety, offering developers complete control over their automation infrastructure.
Seamlessly import and migrate existing workflows from tools like n8n into the open-source Bubble Lab environment.
readme_summary: Bubble Lab is an open-source workflow automation platform designed for developers. It offers full observability, allowing users to monitor execution, track token usage, and debug workflows. A key feature is the ability to export workflows as clean, production-ready TypeScript code, providing control and portability.
description: Open source workflow automation platform built for developers - full observability and code exportability!
